revised_title: North Sea System: Influence of Horizontal Circulation on Tracer Distribution
tldr: This article examines the influence of horizontal circulation on the supply and distribution of tracers in the North Sea. The authors use theoretical analysis and model simulations to show that the distribution of conservative tracers is primarily determined by the residual circulation pattern. They also discuss the distribution of non-conservative tracers and the transport of suspended sediments in the region. The study provides insights into understanding the North Sea system and its environmental processes.
